citation.article-title: Nomenclature of Prochloron didemni (Lewin 1977) sp. nov., nom rev., Prochloron (Lewin 1976) gen. nov., nom. rev., Prochloraceae fam. nov., Prochlorales ord. nov., nom. rev. in the class Photobacteria Gibbons and Murray 1978.

p.s: Description of Prochloron Lewin 1977 gen. nov., nom. rev.
Prochloron (Pro.chlo'ron. M.L. n. Gr. pref. pro before [primordial]; Gr. adj. chforus green; M.L. neut. n. Prochforon the primordial green)
Formerly included as type genus of the division Prochlorophyta Lewin 1976

Cells are motile or not motile, spherical, gram negative cells multiplying either by binary fission or by asymmetrical division; 6 to 25 Î¼m in diameter, surrounded by a peptidoglycan wall; thylakoidal stacks are present around the periphery of the cell, forming a network interconnected by fine strands.
Nonsymbiotic growth is poor and dependent on aminoacids.
The mol% G+C of DNA ranges from 39 to 41.
